isis.stitle: FULL POWER HYDRAULIC ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - OPERATION - WARNING INDICATORS

svcproc.title: WARNING INDICATORS
svcproc.para: Indicators located in the Electronic Gauge Cluster (EGC), are used to display the status of the brake system. Refer to FIGURE 15. Some of the indicators identify conditions that may require service. In addition to the warning indicators, a buzzer is sounded for certain conditions. The following table includes brief descriptions of how each of the indicators is energized. In the event that a lit indicator is the result of a malfunction, diagnostic codes identifying the source of the malfunction will be stored in the ECU memory. Retrieval of the diagnostic codes is explained in Section 5, DIAGNOSIS AND TROUBLESHOOTING . Although the following table lists possible malfunctions for each indicator, some malfunctions such as loss of data link communications, will result in more than one indicator being lit. When the IGN key is turned on a bulb check is performed. The indicators in the gauge cluster will light for about 3 seconds, then turn off.

entry.para: - SOLID ON
Half system failure. A sensor in the HCU has detected low pressure (<1550 psi) in the accumulator for either the front or rear brake circuit.
The ECU sends a J1939 data link signal to the ESC. The ESC sends a J1939 data link signal to the EGC commanding it to turn on the indicator and sound the warning buzzer.
- FLASHING
Full system failure. A sensor in the HCU has detected low pressure (<1550 psi) in the accumulators for both the front and rear brake circuits.
The ECU sends a J1939 data link signal to the ESC. The ESC sends a J1939 data link signal to the EGC commanding it to turn on the indicator and sound the warning buzzer.
The ECU sends a J1939 data link signal to the ECM. Once vehicle speed drops below 25 mph, engine limiting will limit the vehicle speed to 25 mph or less.
- OFF
System pressures are in normal range.
- SOLID ON
Low brake fluid level detected in the Master Cylinder reservoir.

The fluid level sensor on the MC reservoir sends a signal to the ECU. The ECU sends a J1939 data link signal to the ESC. The ESC sends a J1939 data link signal to the EGC commanding it to turn on the indicator.
- OFF
Brake fluid level detected in the Master Cylinder reservoir is at or above MIN.
- SOLID ON
An ABS related fault has been detected by the ECU.
-OR-
Communications between the ECU and the ESC have been lost.
-OR-
The ECU is not receiving power.
When the ECU detects an ABS related fault, it sends a J1939 data link signal to the ESC. The ESC sends a J1939 data link signal to the EGC commanding it to turn on the indicator.
When the ESC does not receive a communication from the ECU within a predetermined period of time, it sends a J1939 data link signal to the EGC commanding it to turn on the indicator.
- OFF
The ECU is receiving power and is communicating with the ESC; and no ABS related faults have been detected by the ECU.
(Vehicles equipped with optional ATC)
- SOLID ON
The TRAC CTRL indicator will be continuously lit whenever:
A traction control related fault has been detected.
The ATC system is operating correctly, and an ATC event is occurring.

When the ECU experiences an ATC event or detects an ATC related fault, it sends a J1939 data link signal to the ESC. The ESC sends a J1939 data link signal to the EGC commanding it to turn on the indicator.
- FLASHING
The TRAC CTRL indicator will be flashing whenever the Mud and Snow mode has been selected using the traction control switch (switch indicator lit).

The ESC senses the position of the dash switch via the switch data link. The ESC sends a J1939 data link signal to the ECU. The ECU sends a J1939 data link signal back to the ESC indicating that the Mud and Snow mode is selected, and that no ATC related faults have been detected. The ESC sends a J1939 data link signal to the EGC commanding it to flash the indicator.
- OFF
The ATC system is operating correctly, the Mud and Snow mode has not been selected, and the vehicle is not experiencing an ATC event.
On vehicles with an additional BRAKE indicator located in one of the indicator quadrants below the speedometer and tach.
- SOLID ON
Low brake fluid level detected in the Master Cylinder reservoir.
(The fluid level sensor on the MC reservoir sends a signal to the ECU. The ECU sends a signal to the indicator relay causing the relay to turn on the indicator.)
Half system failure. A sensor in the HCU has detected low pressure (<1550 psi) in the accumulator for either the front or rear brake circuit.
(The ECU sends a signal to the indicator relay causing the relay to turn on the indicator.)
- FLASHING
Full system failure. A sensor in the HCU has detected low pressure (<1550 psi) in the accumulators for both the front and rear brake circuits.
The ECU sends a signal to the indicator relay causing the relay to turn on the indicator in a flashing pattern.
- OFF
System pressures are in normal range, and the brake fluid level detected in the Master Cylinder reservoir is at or above MIN.
